message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.AI, cs.DC 

The paper discusses a reinforcement learning framework for caching in content delivery networks, which involves both network infrastructure and end users. This suggests that the paper could belong to several sub-categories, including machine learning (cs.LG), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), systems and control (cs.SY), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC). Among these, machine learning (cs.LG) is the most likely sub-category, as the paper focuses on a deep reinforcement learning approach for caching. Networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) and systems and control (cs.SY) are also likely sub-categories, as the paper discusses the role of caching in next-generation content delivery infrastructure and cellular networks. Artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) are less likely sub-categories, but still relevant given the use of reinforcement learning and decentralized caching schemes.
